verses.kjv: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
verses.ct: A wise son listens to his father's instruction, but a mocker refuses to accept correction.

verses.kjv: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.
verses.ct: A person enjoys good things from the words they speak, but the soul of the treacherous craves violence.

verses.kjv: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
verses.ct: Whoever guards what they say protects their life, but whoever talks without restraint will face ruin.

verses.kjv: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.ct: The soul of the lazy person wants everything but gets nothing, while the soul of the hardworking will be richly satisfied.

verses.kjv: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
verses.ct: A righteous person despises dishonesty, but a wicked person brings disgrace and shame on themselves.

verses.kjv: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
verses.ct: Righteousness protects the person who lives with integrity, but wickedness brings down the sinner.

verses.kjv: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.
verses.ct: Some pretend to be wealthy but have nothing; others act poor yet possess great riches.

verses.kjv: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.
verses.ct: A rich person's wealth can serve as a ransom for their life, but a poor person never even faces such threats.

verses.kjv: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.ct: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out.

verses.kjv: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
verses.ct: Arrogance only leads to conflict, but wisdom is found with those who take advice.

verses.kjv: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
verses.ct: Money gained dishonestly will shrink away, but whoever earns it through hard work will see it grow.

verses.kjv: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
verses.ct: Waiting too long for something you hope for makes the heart sick, but a fulfilled desire is like a tree of life.

verses.kjv: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
verses.ct: Whoever rejects the word will face destruction, but whoever deeply respects the commandment will be rewarded.

verses.kjv: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
verses.ct: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, steering people away from the traps of death.

verses.kjv: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.
verses.ct: Good sense wins people's respect, but the path of the unfaithful is rough and hard.

verses.kjv: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.
verses.ct: Every sensible person acts on knowledge, but a fool puts their stupidity on full display.

verses.kjv: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
verses.ct: An unreliable messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy representative brings healing.

verses.kjv: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
verses.ct: Poverty and disgrace come to anyone who ignores correction, but whoever accepts constructive criticism will be honored.

verses.kjv: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
verses.ct: A goal that is finally reached is sweet to the soul, but fools find it unbearable to turn away from evil.

verses.kjv: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
verses.ct: Spend time with wise people and you will become wise, but whoever keeps company with fools will suffer harm.

verses.kjv: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
verses.ct: Trouble chases after sinners, but good things are the reward of the righteous.

verses.kjv: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
verses.ct: A good person leaves an inheritance even for their grandchildren, but the sinner's wealth ends up stored away for the righteous.

verses.kjv: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.
verses.ct: An unplowed field belonging to the poor could produce plenty of food, but injustice sweeps it away.

verses.kjv: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
verses.ct: Whoever refuses to discipline their child actually hates them, but a parent who truly loves their child corrects them early.

verses.kjv: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
verses.ct: The righteous eat until their appetite is satisfied, but the stomach of the wicked goes empty.
